void tx_append ( Text *  dest,
const Text *  src 
)

Appends to one Text interface another.

Parameters:
dest[in:out] this one will be appended with src
src[in] this one will be appended to dest

char tx_at ( Text *  txt,
unsigned int  index 
)

Gives character from the Text that is at given position.

Parameters:
txt[in] Text from which character is returned.
index[in] denotes the index of character in Text. It starts from 0
Returns:
character that is at index position in Text. In case of failure is returned.

const char *  chars 
)

Removes specified set of characters from the end of Text

Parameters:
txt[in:out] the Text to be altered.
chars[in] set of charatcer that will be removed from the end of Text

Text* tx_create ( const char *  txt  ) 

Creates Text structure and initializes it with given value.

Parameters:
txt[in] the string that will initialize Text interface.
Returns:
allocated Text structure or INITPTR in case of failure.

void tx_destroy ( Text **  txt  ) 

Destroys Text structure previously allocated with tx_create.

Parameters:
txt[in:out] Text interface to be deallocated.
Note:
after deletion the pointer to Text interface is set to INITPTR

char* tx_get_buf ( Text *  txt  ) 

Getter for c string representation of data held in Text interface.

Parameters:
txt[in] Text interface from which the data are returned.
Returns:
pointer to copy of the data held by Text interface.
Note:
obtained pointer needs to be freed by using for example free()

void tx_int_append ( Text *  dest,
const char *  flags,
int  src 
)

Appends to Text interface an integer.

Parameters:
dest[in:out] this one will be appended with src
flags[in] like in printf: [flags][width][.precision][length]
src[in] integer to be appended to dest

void tx_prepend ( Text *  src,
Text *  dest 
)

Appends to one Text interface another.

Parameters:
dest[in:out] this one will be appended with src
src[in] this one will be preppended to dest

char* tx_share_buf ( Text *  txt  ) 

Getter for adress of data held in Text interface.

Parameters:
txt[in] Text interface from which the pointer is returned.
Returns:
pointer to the data held by Text interface.
Note:
obtainted pointer should not be freed by using free()
